course_description: Provides an introduction to the entire spectrum of vaccines and immunization: from basic bench research through testing, licensure, and use; program design, implementation and evaluation; and social, economic, and political factors affecting the use of vaccines. Primary emphasis will be on the international setting but examples will also be taken from developed countries. Cross-listed with GH 566.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 1125, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 10-11:50a, Instructor: Hinman/Datta, Status: Closed
